content.text:
Lady Gaga
"Always Remember Us This Way"

Standard tuning.


[Verse 1]
             [ch]Am[/ch]                  [ch]F[/ch]
That Arizona sky burning in your eyes
    [ch]C[/ch]                                      [ch]G[/ch]
You look at me and, babe, I wanna catch on fire
                  [ch]Am[/ch]                   [ch]F[/ch]
It’s buried in my soul like California gold
    [ch]C[/ch]                                     [ch]G[/ch]
You found the light in me that I couldn’t find


[Chorus]
            [ch]F[/ch]
So when I'm all choked up
                     [ch]C[/ch]
And I can't find the words
      [ch]Am[/ch]
Every time we say goodbye
         [ch]G[/ch]
Baby, it hurts
         [ch]F[/ch]   [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]Am[/ch]
When the sun goes down
        [ch]F[/ch]    [ch]G[/ch]     [ch]C[/ch]
And the band won't play
     [ch]F[/ch]       [ch]G[/ch]               [ch]C[/ch]
I'll always remember us this way


[Verse 2]
              [ch]Am[/ch]
Lovers in the night
                [ch]F[/ch]
Poets trying to write
   [ch]C[/ch]
We don't know how to rhyme
            [ch]G[/ch]

name: The Sound Of Silence

content.text:
Simon & Garfunkel - The Sound of Silence

Standard tuning
         
                                           [ch]Dm[/ch]
Throughout the intro you pluck like so: e|---1---1---1---1-|
                                        B|-----3-------3---|
                                        G|-2-------2-------|
                                        D|-----------------|
                                        A|-----------------|
                                        E|-----------------|

The only plucking part of the song is the intro, the rest is strumming, you'll have
to listen to the song to find the rhythm. Good luck.


[Intro] 

(Start plucking on the 'G' string, and say "Hello" on the third time you pluck
the 'B' string. The rest of the chords are above the corresponding syllables, just keep
the plucking rhythm while you transition.)


[ch]Dm[/ch]                        [ch]C[/ch]
    Hello darkness my old friend
                           [ch]Dm[/ch]
I've come to talk with you again
          [ch]F[/ch]          [ch]Bb[/ch]      [ch]F[/ch]
Because a vision softly creeping
                       [ch]Bb[/ch]       [ch]F[/ch]
Left his seeds while I was sleeping
        [ch]Bb[/ch]                            [ch]F[/ch]
And the vision that was planted in my brain
               [ch]Dm[/ch]   [ch]F[/ch]            [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]Dm[/ch]          
Still remain          within the sound of silence.


[Verse 1]

                             [ch]C[/ch]
In restless dreams I walked alone
                          [ch]Dm[/ch]
Narrow streets of cobbled stone
           [ch]F[/ch]       [ch]Bb[/ch]       [ch]F[/ch]
'Neath the halo of a street lamp
                          [ch]Bb[/ch]       [ch]F[/ch]
I turned my collar to the cold and damp
        [ch]Bb[/ch]                                       [ch]F[/ch]
When my eyes were stabbed by the flash of a neon light
                       [ch]Dm[/ch]   [ch]F[/ch]                 [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]Dm[/ch]
That split the night          and touched the sound of silence.


[Verse 2]

                         [ch]C[/ch]
And in the naked light I saw
                          [ch]Dm[/ch]
Ten thousand people maybe more
       [ch]F[/ch]           [ch]Bb[/ch]       [ch]F[/ch]
People talking without speaking
                   [ch]Bb[/ch]        [ch]F[/ch]
People hearing without listening
               [ch]Bb[/ch]                      [ch]F[/ch]
People writing songs that voices never share 
                  [ch]Dm[/ch]   [ch]F[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]Dm[/ch]
And no one dare          disturb the sound of silence


[Verse 3]

                        [ch]C[/ch]
Fools said I you do not know
                      [ch]Dm[/ch]
Silence like a cancer grow
        [ch]F[/ch]            [ch]Bb[/ch]          [ch]F[/ch]
Hear my words that I might teach you
                   [ch]Bb[/ch]          [ch]F[/ch]
Take my arm that I might reach you
       [ch]Bb[/ch]                          [ch]F[/ch]
But my words like silent raindrops fell
[ch]Dm[/ch]       [ch]F[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]       [ch]Dm[/ch]
     And echoed in the well of silence


[Verse 4]

                         [ch]C[/ch]
And the people bowed and prayed
                     [ch]Dm[/ch]
To the neon god they made
        [ch]F[/ch]                [ch]Bb[/ch]      [ch]F[/ch]
And the sign flashed out its warning
                     [ch]Bb[/ch]      [ch]F[/ch]
In the words that it was forming

And the sign said 
    [ch]Bb[/ch]                                              [ch]F[/ch]
The words of the prophets are written on the subway walls
                     [ch]Dm[/ch]       [ch]F[/ch]                [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]Dm[/ch]
And tenement halls        and whispered in the sound of silence


Enjoy,
Todd

content.text:
Here you go...a real easy song..just uses 4 chords: Am C G and D. The strumming pattern is
simple as well...down down down up down up or just down, down down up if you want. Or you
could pick the notes if you want, it sounds cool either way.

This is how I play the song, so I think it's pretty accurate. :) It is my first tab, and 
is meant for beginners like me, so the guitar pros - go easy on me!

Capo 8 for original key of F minor.


[Intro]
[ch]Am[/ch]    [ch]D[/ch]    x2


[Verse 1]

[ch]Am[/ch]                [ch]C[/ch]
All around me are familiar faces
[ch]G[/ch]                 [ch]D[/ch]
Worn out places – worn out faces
[ch]Am[/ch]                          [ch]C[/ch]
Bright and early for their daily races
[ch]G[/ch]               [ch]D[/ch]
Going nowhere – going nowhere
[ch]Am[/ch]                      [ch]C[/ch]
Their tears are filling up their glasses
[ch]G[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]
No expression – no expression
[ch]Am[/ch]                     [ch]C[/ch]
Hide my head I want to drown my sorrow
[ch]G[/ch]           [ch]D[/ch]
No tomorrow – no tomorrow

Wicked Game is a 1989 song by Chris Isaak from his third studio album Heart Shaped World. 
Atlanta radio station began playing the song and it quickly became a nationwide top ten 
hit in January 1991, reaching #6 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart, making it the first hit 
song of his career.

Hey folks, here's the fixed version! This song sounds best using the 
[ch]Em7[/ch] with using just your birdie finger, usually just "walking" 
the base note from the C down to the [ch]Am[/ch].  

[ch]Em7[/ch] x2xx0x
[ch]G[/ch]   32000x
  
Anyways, you've got a couple of picking options with this song; 
I use the classic pinch Travis picking pattern pretty much all the 
way through for this one. This adds a little more sound when using a 
single guitar. If you're on a C chord this is what the pattern looks like:

e|-------------------|
B|--o----------o-----|
G|--------o----------|
D|-----o---------o---|
A|--o-------o--------|
E|-------------------|  (Pinch, in-side out-side in)

Or you can use the alternating outside/inside pattern at the end of the intro:

[Intro]
e|-3-0---0-----0---|---0-------------|-----------------|------------------||
B|-----3---3-----3-|-----3---1-----1-|---1-------1-----|---1-------1------||
G|-----------3-----|-0-----0---3-0---|-------0-------0-|-------0-------0--||
D|-----------------|-----------------|-----2-------2---|-----2-------2----||
A|-----------------|-----------------|-3---------------|-3----------------||
E|-----------------|-----------------|---------3-------|---------3--------|| Repeat Outside/inside
